Jimm,

the code you're looking for is in Eclipse as part of the JUnit
support.  It isn't part of JUnit itself.

Jtf

On 12/29/06, junitheadache <bohs01@...> wrote:
> Hi Bob,
>
>
> Actually, I've already done the "by hand" part, where by i used a
> template of sorts to fill in information i needed, and used
> Equivalence partitioning and boundary analysis to pick suitable
> values.
>
> I was actually considering writing from scratch the production codes
> to read in the template and generate teh code, however my final goal
> was to integrate it with JUnit and I thought it would be easier if I
> could just build ontop of JUnit's existing source code for
> generating the test class template it currently has.
>
> The problem now is, I cant seem to find the code of JUnit that
> generates the test class template... this is the part where i badly
> need help. I've dled the JUnit 3.8.1 source code and look through
> them, but either I am missing it or its not there.
>
> It might be in the Junit runtime class files, however the source
> codes for those are unavailable on sourceforge?
>
> Need Help,
> Jimm
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bob Runstein" <rrunstein@...> wrote:
> >
> > > On 12/27/06, junitheadache
> > > <bohs01@> wrote:
> > > Hi all,
> > >
> > > I am currently working on auto generation of test
> > > cases for TDD for
> > > my honors year project. And was considering
> > > modifying JUnit such
> > > that it will auto generate some test cases based
> > > values flagged by
> > > users.
> >
> > How about considering a project where you generate the unit tests
> by
> > hand and then auto generate the production code from them? Now
> that
> > would be something!
> >
> > Bob
> >
>
